page.title: 11TRANSPORT _ RAGDALE AREA
page.content:
There is one major road in the Ragdale area. That is the A46 Trunk Road, from Leicester to Newark. It is an old Roman road, known as the Fosse Way. This road crosses the north_west corner of the area with a major intersection at Six Hills, where the B676, Loughborough to Melton Mowbray road, passes underneath the A46. A bus service, operated by Bartons of Nottingham, uses the A46 on its journies between Nottingham and Leicester. It is a dual carriageway. The A6006 crosses the north_east corner of the Ragdale area on its way between Loughborough and Melton Mowbray.
The road through Ragdale to Hoby is a small country road which winds between hedgerows, following the undulated contours of the land.
